title: Project One
subtitle: Reason for developing Project One, what does it solve?

title: Wildfire Danger Prediction using Long Short-Term Memory Network
subtitle: Wildfires are a serious threat to public safety in the US and across the world. I pull two years of daily wildfire indices and climate metrics (temperature, wind) from near Yosemite Valley, CA and use a LSTM neural network to effectively train and tune a research model for real-time advisory. The resulting network is able to learn and accurately capture trends and conditions prone to wildfires, leading to an MSE of 0.05 upon generalization.

title: Algorithmic improvements of the Fast Fourier Transform (FFT)
subtitle: The Fast Fourier Transform, by turning boring time-domain data to useful frequency-domain data, is used in industries from telecommunications to MRIs. As many technologists claim the FFT as the greatest, and most widespread technological advancement of the 20th century, how has the FFT made real-time applications of data-intensive processes possible?

title: Stacked model salary prediction
subtitle: Visualized predictions from a stack of supervised learners (k-means, random forest, and the support vector regressor) to decrease the variance and error in predictions. Visualized the performance of the meta learner, depicting distinct learning performance despite a high MSE.

title: Password Hash Cracking on Compromised User-Password Database
subtitle: Effectively identified 13 compromised accounts by matching common cryptographic hashes with leaked user password hashes from a leaked and encrypted database.

title: Optimized linear regression model for 'house price / unit area'
subtitle: Constuctucted a gradient descent linear regression model with robust data preprocessing and exploratory data analysis (EDA), prediciting house price per unit area with MSE of 0.38 through hyperparameter tuning and feature extraction.

title: Crib-Dragging Cryptanalysis
subtitle: Successfully decrypted 11 XOR-encrypted message exchanges using a crib-dragging algorithm, leveraging Python and online frameworks to iteratively validate findings and reveal ciphertext due to the insecure One-Time Pad (OTP) setup.

title: Customizable bionic reading browser extension
subtitle: Researched in a class group of 5 on the impacts of varying visual stimuli (boldness, spacing, fonts, etc.) to improve reading experience for neurodivergent individuals. We evaluated the impact for users applying bionic reading into their reading as well addressing the limitations of PDF accessibility to bionic reading applications.

title: Maintained operational invariance for a simulated bakery.
subtitle: Synchronized a 200-customer thread pool to buy random amounts of random types of bread (sourdough, etc) and confirmed the correct update of the customer purchases, sales, and stock with process logging and avoiding danger of race conditions via semaphore logic.

title: College alignment analytics template
subtitle: Developed a college alignment scheme based on weighting user-defined criteria to evaluate and order programs that align best.

title: Initiated and proposed website redevelopment for NHC Events, LLC
subtitle: Proposed a front-end redevelopment of the venue website via React to redesign the virtual storefront and remove bugs. Conducted market research and communicated with management and photographers to use preferrable content for user interface.

title: Redeveloped Linux command-line interface (CLI)
subtitle: Refunctionalized commands ‘cd’, ‘stat’, and ‘ll’ and restyled Ubuntu CLI, synchronizing inter-process communication (IPC) by forking and replacing the current process image to evaluate all other commands to improve efficiency through concurrency.

title: Reimplemented data buffer functions fprintf() and fscanf() in ‘stdio.h’
subtitle: Rewrote data manipulation functions fprintf() and fscanf() from the ‘stdio.h’ C library using 7 other POSIX standard APIs and featuring a clean() function which closes all open files in the process, if any.

title: Simulated Runge-Kutta methods of orbits in the 1st to 4th order
subtitle: Calculated and visualized orbital trajectory using Runge-Kutta orbital approximations in the 1st to 4th differential order using Python and matplotlib.

title: Tiling The Courtyard: Inductive Program
subtitle: A program developed in Racket (by EOPL) which runs an inductive algorithm on a 2^(n) x 2^(n) (n==input) courtyard of tiles to place 'trominos' strategically such that there is one 'filler' tile left untouched. Users can enter any natural number and display the tiled courtyard labelled by numbers up to ((2^n)*(2^n)-1)/3.

title: Healing helper medical device research and development
subtitle: Developed an ankle brace medical wearable in a team of 4 to combat slow healing with user analytics of force on injury. Spearheaded embedded system programming in C++, calibrating 4 load cells in the sole accurately to measure force.
